intro: Fumana viscida var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved fumana, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
